com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Enum BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh>
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh>
    Enclosing interface:
    BleManager.UhOhListener

    public static enum BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh
extends java.lang.Enum<BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh>
    An UhOh is a warning about an exceptional (in the bad sense) and unfixable problem with the underlying stack that the app can warn its user about. It's kind of like an Exception but they can be so common that using Exception would render this library unusable without a rat's nest of try/catches. Instead you implement BleManager.UhOhListener to receive them. Each BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh has a getRemedy() that suggests what might be done about it.
    See Also:
    BleManager.UhOhListener, BleManager.setListener_UhOh(BleManager.UhOhListener)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BOND_TIMED_OUT
      A BleTask.BOND operation timed out.
      CANNOT_DISABLE_BLUETOOTH
      BluetoothAdapter.disable(), through BleManager.turnOff(), is failing to complete.
      CANNOT_ENABLE_BLUETOOTH
      BluetoothAdapter.enable(), through BleManager.turnOn(), is failing to complete.
      CLASSIC_DISCOVERY_FAILED
      BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed and BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded is true so we try BluetoothAdapter.startDiscovery() but that also fails...fun!
      CONCURRENT_EXCEPTION
      Occasionally, when trying to get the native GattService, android will throw a ConcurrentModificationException.
      CONNECTED_WITHOUT_EVER_CONNECTING
      BluetoothGatt.getConnectionState(BluetoothDevice) says we're connected but we never tried to connect in the first place.
      DEAD_OBJECT_EXCEPTION
      Similar in concept to RANDOM_EXCEPTION but used when DeadObjectException is thrown.
      DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND
      A BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() operation returned two duplicate services.
      INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_BLE_STATE
      When the underlying stack meets a race condition where BluetoothAdapter.getState() does not match the value provided through BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED with BluetoothAdapter.EXTRA_STATE.
      INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_DEVICE_STATE
      This can be thrown when the underlying state from BluetoothManager.getConnectionState(BluetoothDevice, int) does not match the apparent condition of the device (for instance, you perform a scan, then try to connect to a device, but it reports as being connected...in this case, it cannot be connected, AND advertising).
      OLD_DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND
      A BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() operation returned a service instance that we already received before after disconnecting and reconnecting.
      RANDOM_EXCEPTION
      The underlying native BLE stack enjoys surprising you with random exceptions.
      READ_RETURNED_NULL
      A BleDevice.read(java.util.UUID, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) returned with a null characteristic value.
      READ_TIMED_OUT
      A BleDevice.read(java.util.UUID, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) took longer than timeout set by BleNodeConfig.taskTimeoutRequestFilter.
      SERVICE_DISCOVERY_IMMEDIATELY_FAILED
      BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() failed right off the bat and returned false.
      START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED
      BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed and BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded is false.
      START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED__USING_CLASSIC
      BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed for an unknown reason.
      UNKNOWN_BLE_ERROR
      Just a blanket case for when the library has to completely shrug its shoulders.
      WRITE_TIMED_OUT
      Similar to READ_TIMED_OUT but for BleDevice.write(java.util.UUID, byte[]).

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BOND_TIMED_OUT

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh BOND_TIMED_OUT
        A BleTask.BOND operation timed out. This can happen a lot with the Galaxy Tab 4, and doing BleManager.reset() seems to fix it. SweetBlue does as much as it can to work around the issue that causes bond timeouts, but some might still slip through.

      • READ_TIMED_OUT

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh READ_TIMED_OUT
        A BleDevice.read(java.util.UUID, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) took longer than timeout set by BleNodeConfig.taskTimeoutRequestFilter. You will also get a BleDevice.ReadWriteListener.ReadWriteEvent with BleDevice.ReadWriteListener.Status.TIMED_OUT but a timeout is a sort of fringe case that should not regularly happen.

      • READ_RETURNED_NULL

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh READ_RETURNED_NULL
        A BleDevice.read(java.util.UUID, BleDevice.ReadWriteListener) returned with a null characteristic value. The null value will end up as an empty array in BleDevice.ReadWriteListener.ReadWriteEvent.data() so app-land doesn't have to do any special null handling.

      • WRITE_TIMED_OUT

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh WRITE_TIMED_OUT
        Similar to READ_TIMED_OUT but for BleDevice.write(java.util.UUID, byte[]).

      • INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_BLE_STATE

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_BLE_STATE
        When the underlying stack meets a race condition where BluetoothAdapter.getState() does not match the value provided through BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED with BluetoothAdapter.EXTRA_STATE.

      • DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND
        A BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() operation returned two duplicate services. Not the same instance necessarily but the same UUID.

      • OLD_DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh OLD_DUPLICATE_SERVICE_FOUND
        A BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() operation returned a service instance that we already received before after disconnecting and reconnecting.

      • START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED__USING_CLASSIC

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED__USING_CLASSIC
        BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed for an unknown reason. The library is now using BluetoothAdapter.startDiscovery() instead.
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded

      • CONNECTED_WITHOUT_EVER_CONNECTING

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh CONNECTED_WITHOUT_EVER_CONNECTING
        BluetoothGatt.getConnectionState(BluetoothDevice) says we're connected but we never tried to connect in the first place. My theory is that this can happen on some phones when you quickly restart the app and the stack doesn't have a chance to disconnect from the device entirely.

      • DEAD_OBJECT_EXCEPTION

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh DEAD_OBJECT_EXCEPTION
        Similar in concept to RANDOM_EXCEPTION but used when DeadObjectException is thrown.

      • RANDOM_EXCEPTION

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh RANDOM_EXCEPTION
        The underlying native BLE stack enjoys surprising you with random exceptions. Every time a new one is discovered it is wrapped in a try/catch and this BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh is dispatched.

      • CONCURRENT_EXCEPTION

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh CONCURRENT_EXCEPTION
        Occasionally, when trying to get the native GattService, android will throw a ConcurrentModificationException. This can happen when trying to perform any read or write. Usually, you simply have to just try again.

      • START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh START_BLE_SCAN_FAILED
        BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed and BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded is false.
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded

      • CLASSIC_DISCOVERY_FAILED

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh CLASSIC_DISCOVERY_FAILED
        BluetoothAdapter.startLeScan(BluetoothAdapter.LeScanCallback) failed and BleManagerConfig.revertToClassicDiscoveryIfNeeded is true so we try BluetoothAdapter.startDiscovery() but that also fails...fun!

      • SERVICE_DISCOVERY_IMMEDIATELY_FAILED

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh SERVICE_DISCOVERY_IMMEDIATELY_FAILED
        BluetoothGatt.discoverServices() failed right off the bat and returned false.

      • CANNOT_DISABLE_BLUETOOTH

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh CANNOT_DISABLE_BLUETOOTH
        BluetoothAdapter.disable(), through BleManager.turnOff(), is failing to complete. We always end up back at BluetoothAdapter.STATE_ON.

      • CANNOT_ENABLE_BLUETOOTH

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh CANNOT_ENABLE_BLUETOOTH
        BluetoothAdapter.enable(), through BleManager.turnOn(), is failing to complete. We always end up back at BluetoothAdapter.STATE_OFF. Opposite problem of CANNOT_DISABLE_BLUETOOTH

      • INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_DEVICE_STATE

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh INCONSISTENT_NATIVE_DEVICE_STATE
        This can be thrown when the underlying state from BluetoothManager.getConnectionState(BluetoothDevice, int) does not match the apparent condition of the device (for instance, you perform a scan, then try to connect to a device, but it reports as being connected...in this case, it cannot be connected, AND advertising). It seems the values from this method are cached, so sometimes this cache gets "stuck" in the connected state. In this case, it may be best to clear cache of the Bluetooth app (Sometimes called Bluetooth Cache).

      • UNKNOWN_BLE_ERROR

        public static final BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh UNKNOWN_BLE_ERROR
        Just a blanket case for when the library has to completely shrug its shoulders.
